parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF11240003) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for campaign finance reporting and are mandated for political advertising.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "Pop Sebastian Tiberiu" as a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies for the PNCR (Partidul Național Conservator Român). This clearly identifies a parliamentary candidate and fulfills Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, the content is designed to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The use of hashtags further amplifies this reach, targeting a broader public.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's primary objective is to promote Pop Sebastian Tiberiu's candidacy and his legislative initiative focused on civic education. While discussing civic education is not inherently electoral, the clear association with his candidacy and the use of campaign hashtags ("#ViitorulEAlTău", "#TineriiVotează", etc.) strongly suggests an electoral objective to influence voters' choices. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post presents information about civic education in other European countries, its primary focus is not journalistic. The presentation is biased towards promoting the candidate's initiative and ultimately influencing voters.  It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not a personal opinion; it's a structured presentation of a political platform and legislative proposal directly linked to the candidate's campaign. The personal opinions are subordinated to the electoral objective.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>937272021083576</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda under Romanian law. It contains a CMF number, clearly identifies a parliamentary candidate, targets a wide audience, has an electoral objective, and lacks journalistic neutrality. The content is designed to promote the candidate and influence voters' choices.  The inclusion of campaign hashtags further reinforces this conclusion.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Pop Sebastian Tiberiu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNCR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Entitatea responsabilă de postare], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 937272021083576) cu conținut electoral, care promovează candidatura lui Pop Sebastian Tiberiu pentru Camera Deputaților din partea PNCR,  folosind un număr CMF (CMF11240003),  hashtag-uri electorale (#ViitorulEAlTău, #TineriiVotează etc.) și prezentând o inițiativă legislativă în mod evident legată de campania electorală, având ca efect electoral influențarea pozitivă a voturilor pentru candidatul menționat.  Postarea, deși abordează tema educației civice, nu are un caracter jurnalistic obiectiv, ci servește exclusiv scopului promovării candidaturii.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
